entry.title: Counting Cities
Collecting Numbers
Missing Coin Sum
entry.content:
problem link: https://cses.fi/problemset/task/2183

refernces:

Explanation

First we sort the all the n elements.

We declare a varible sum which represents, from 0 to sum we can create the sum of coins. Initially, sum is 0, ie we don’t take any element from array.

Now we iterate through the sorted array. For each element x in the array, since sum represents maximum summation we can get from previously taken array elements, we can get summation upto sum + x iff x <= sum. Otherwise, there would not be any combination which could sum up to from sum to 0 + x, and smallest one among those will obiviously be sum.

Code

entry.title: Sum Of Two Values
entry.content:
problem link: https://cses.fi/problemset/task/1640/

refernces: Binary search

Explanation

Sort the array in O(NlogN) and then iterate through the array. For each element A, binary search the array for sum - A.

entry.title: Movie Festival
entry.content:
problem link: https://cses.fi/problemset/task/1629/

refernces:

Explanation

Simple greedy algorithm. First sort the movies in descreasing order of ending time and then count the movies which are not overlapping with next one. If they are, skip the movie.
